channel.title: Npcdrops
channel.description: I have a Greater demon in autospawn.cfg and Coins as it's drop in. npcdrops.cfg and I have a method for it in NPChandler. But yet still it does'nt drop anything. I'm using a Blank client could that be the problem? If not, any ideas what could be? :/

item.title: Npcdrops
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

[quote=“savethefatunicorns, post:9, topic:370554”]OOPS, I meant too post this. Sorry i’m kind of distracted atm. Babysitting my neice. This is what’s in my npcdrops.cfg

//--------NPCID---------DropType--------Item----Amount–

And I have no idea what a PI base is anyways. I can find the post where I downloaded the source and client. if that helps.[/quote]

well thats not PI,

looks like your on delta

just follow that format and add a drop for the npc

Read full topic

item.description:
@savethefatunicorns wrote:

OOPS, I meant too post this. Sorry i’m kind of distracted atm. Babysitting my neice. This is what’s in my npcdrops.cfg

//--------NPCID---------DropType--------Item----Amount–

And I have no idea what a PI base is anyways. I can find the post where I downloaded the source and client. if that helps.

Read full topic

item.title: Npcdrops
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

savethefatunicorns:

Errr, I don’t even remember what base I’m using. I’m fairly new too makin rsps’s. So, I know i’m using a 317. And that it’s a blank client. Well i’m slowly figuring out. It’s not blank whats so ever. All they did was clear the autospawn,shops,and npcs. And can’t I just add a drop rate? Cause all I did was copy a line too keep it in order. e.g //------NpcID—CoordX–CoordY–Height–RangeX1-RangeY1-RangeX2-RangeY2-WalkType-Description. So, should I just add a drop rate?

That is npc spawning, not npc drops.
And it appears that you are on PI,

Although im not sure, but if you are using a PI base,
then Npc drops are handled in NPCDrops.TSM,

there are two NPCDrop files, make sure you open the .TSM and not the .CFG

Read full topic

item.title: Npcdrops
item.dc:creator: @Mercifies Mercifies
item.description:
@Mercifies wrote:

You either have a broken Cfg as I like to call it or you are using the wrong code. Yes, it should have a drop rate as should all of the monsters. If you have a broken Cfg file, then you are pretty much out of luck, and depending how far into the development of the server you are, you may just want to find a new source instead of tying to fix your Cfg file.

Read full topic

item.title: Npcdrops
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

u made sure u did it this way?? in npcdrops.cfg

npcdrop = 15	6893	1	100

15= npc that drop it
6893 = item that get dropped
1 = how many he drop it
100 = drop rate like if u do it 50 its half half get the item

Read full topic
